cli.longDescription: This is a mostly developer-facing CLI for the Solo2 Desktop App - for a more comprehensive CLI experience, please install the solo2-cli (https://github.com/solokeys/solo2-cli) which aside from a more extensive feature set, also offers a more thoughtful CLI experience including tab completion and sensible subcommand grouping.

update.longDescription: This command will update the Solo2 Desktop App to the latest version available. If the update is successful, the app will restart automatically.

args.name: version
args.description: The version to update to. If not specified, the latest version will be used.

version.description: Print the version of the Solo2 Desktop App
version.longDescription: This command will print the version of the Solo2 Desktop App to the console.

ctap2.description: Run a CTAP2 commands - warning: requires administrative privileges on Windows

list.description: List all FIDO2-enabled Solo2 devices connected to the system
list.longDescription: This command will list all Solo2 devices connected to the system.

args.name: device
args.description: The device to list credentials for. If not specified, the first device found will be used.

args.name: pin
args.description: The PIN to use when authenticating to the device. If not specified, the user will be prompted to enter the PIN.

list.description: List all credentials stored on the specified device
list.longDescription: This command will list all credentials stored on the specified device.

delete.description: Delete a credential from the specified device
delete.longDescription: This command will delete a credential from the specified device.

delete-all.description: Delete all credentials from the specified device
delete-all.longDescription: This command will delete all credentials from the specified device.

update.description: Update a credential on the specified device. WARNING: this is a developer-only command and is not intended for end-users.

args.name: did
args.description: The credential descriptor ID to update.

args.name: uid
args.description: The user entity ID to update.

args.name: name
args.description: The user entity name to update.

args.name: displayName
args.description: The user entity display name to update.

args.name: version
args.description: The version to update to. If not specified, the latest version will be used.
